title: Florida police department celebrates 100-year-old veteran's birthday with car parade
summary:
The Fort Pierce Police Department in Florida threw a parade on Tuesday honoring military veteran Clarence McDuffie in celebration of his 100th birthday.
Officers organized a patrol car parade for the Georgia born U.S. Army veteran, to salute his service in World War II, CBS 12 reported.
McDuffie has lived in Fort Pierce since the 1950s, following the war.
DESANTIS SLAMS SCHOOL CLOSURE IDEA, SAYS IT'S 'OFF THE TABLE'McDuffie is reportedly a father of seven and has 17 grandchildren.
CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APPHe also has close to 35 great-grandchildren, some of whom participated in parade festivities and stopped by to wish him a happy birthday.

McDuffie has lived in Fort Pierce since the 1950s, following the war.
